image.altText: The town of Tennant Creek

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 52-year-old man for gross indecency against a child under 10 years following the investigation of an alleged sexual assault that occurred in Tennant Creek on Wednesday.

title.children: Man charged following alleged sexual assault of child in Tennant Creek

image.altText: The exterior of the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre, showing the building surrounding by a barbed wire fence.

props.synopsis: The teenager's lawyer has argued that evidence including CCTV footage, allegedly showing him punching the guards and throwing urine on them, should be excluded from the case on the grounds that it was "unlawfully obtained".

title.children: Youth fighting assault charges in Don Dale seeks to scrap evidence, alleging unlawful deprivation of food and lockdowns

image.altText: The exterior of the NAAJA building in Darwin.

props.synopsis: After months of turmoil that have sparked concerns for its funding, the board of NAAJA has defended itself amid suggestions the organisation is unable to do its job.

title.children: Embattled Aboriginal law firm insists full services will resume, amid funding concerns

image.altText: A Chinese research vessel.

props.synopsis: In a high-profile speech laying out Australia's Indian Ocean strategy, the foreign minister warned against political interference and economic coercion, urging China to be more transparent about its military build-up.

title.children: Penny Wong delivers Indian Ocean strategy speech, urges China to be more transparent amid military build-up

image.altText: A close-up of Prince Harry who wears a suit and has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Prince Harry's lawyer says the royal has settled the remainder of his lawsuit against Mirror Group Newspapers over phone-hacking and other unlawful acts.

title.children: Prince Harry vows to continue mission to change press after settling phone-hacking lawsuit

image.altText: A massive dark fire burns next to a blue beach

props.synopsis: A factory fire in Perth's heavy industrial complex has seen a toxic smoke warning issued for more than 40,000 people living in nearby suburbs.

title.children: More than 40,000 people caught up in sulphur dioxide toxic smoke warning in Perth

image.altText: Australian T20I cricketer David Warner looks up in the air as he finishes his swing of the bat for a boundary.

props.synopsis: Australia's David Warner marks his 100th T20 International with a brilliant 70, as the West Indies fall short of running down a record chase in Hobart to lose the first game of the series.

title.children: Big Warner knock in landmark T20I sets up Aussie win in Hobart

image.altText: A split shot of a woman in  a dress and in running gear.

props.synopsis: Police are mystified about the missing Ballarat woman's movements "from the moment she left home" as they make another appeal for public help and missing persons unit detectives take charge.

title.children: CFA crews withdrawn from Samantha Murphy search as more detectives join case

image.altText: Kurtley Beale dressed in a suit and addresses the media after the verdict

props.synopsis: Former Wallaby Kurtley Beale is found not guilty by a jury of sexual offences against a woman at a Bondi pub.

title.children: Kurtley Beale says he's glad 'the truth has come out' after being cleared of sexual offences

image.altText: Michele Bullock

props.synopsis: RBA governor Michele Bullock says Australia doesn't need higher interest rates right now, despite calls from IMF and OECD.

title.children: RBA governor Michele Bullock says she doesn't agree with IMF that Australia needs higher interest rates

image.altText: India's Bharatiya Janata Party supporters celebrate after Uttarakhand state lawmakers passed a new civil code.

props.synopsis: The new civil code requires unmarried couples to register their relationships and bans polygamy, which some Indians say invades their privacy and erodes their religious freedoms.

title.children: Couples in an Indian state could face jail time for not registering their relationship

image.altText: Joe Biden, in a dark blue suit, blue tie, wearing sunglasses, walking through a garden, leaving the White House

props.synopsis: Today's report into Joe Biden's handling of confidential documents he took when he was a senator and vice president has ruled out criminal charges, but it has raised other serious questions, writes Carrington Clarke.

title.children: 'An elderly man with a poor memory': The special counsel description that Biden's rivals will use to discredit him

image.altText: Processing plant

props.synopsis: Elmore, the mining company that runs the Peko iron ore and gold mine in Tennant Creek, reported a loss of almost $24 million last financial year. It has told the ASX it is "insolvent or likely to become insolvent at some future time".

title.children: 'It's a bleak day': Operator of Tennant Creek mine enters voluntary administration

image.altText: Police sectioning off a street.

props.synopsis: A man has been shot near a busy Melbourne train station as police were responding to an unrelated incident on Friday evening.

title.children: Melbourne bridge cordoned off after police shooting in city centre

image.altText: Meryl, as Miranda, sits at her desk and looked pointedly down her nose in a judgmental way, with her hand on her hip

props.synopsis: The Oscars have added a new category for the first time in more than two decades, with casting set to be honoured alongside acting, writing and directing. Here are five films we wish were honoured at the time.

title.children: The Oscars will (finally) start awarding Best Casting, so here are five films that should have won

image.altText: Mitchell Street is the main strip of the Darwin city.

props.synopsis: The Buy Local Plan is designed to ensure the largest proportion of NT government spending goes to local businesses. Data shows that objective is not being met.

title.children: Increased proportion of NT government spending left the territory last year, data shows

image.altText: Black and white image of a tall man in a suit

props.synopsis: Former Perth Wildcats basketballer Tiny Pinder apologises to his victims amid his latest sexual assault convictions, as his lawyer says he has the cognitive capacity of a 14-year-old. WARNING: The story contains details of sexual assault.

title.children: Former NBL basketballer Tiny Pinder admits 'stupid mistakes' at 'violent' sexual assault court hearing

image.altText: John Tucker and Lara Alexander speak to media.

props.synopsis: The two Tasmanian Liberals turned independents say they want to "resolve this crisis" and with the Premier saying he'll consider their demands it seems the last Liberal government in Australia won't face an election — not in the next few days anyway.

title.children: No election called for Tasmania — with Liberal premier to consider demands of independents

image.altText: A photo taken inside a Toyota, showing a man's arm on the steering wheel as it drives down a road between snow-capped hills

props.synopsis: As experts push to strengthen Australia's privacy laws, many car makers are gathering data and potentially selling it to third parties.

title.children: These major car companies are accused of harvesting and exploiting customer data

image.altText: Elizabeth Magistrates court

props.synopsis: The Elizabeth Magistrates Court hears Ethan Ross allegedly administered over-the-counter drug naloxone and methamphetamine to Amy Bowden to try and reverse the effects of a heroin overdose.

title.children: Man accused of administering drugs to partner faces court following her death

image.altText: Vladimir putin against a background collage of multiple men in black and white

props.synopsis: An antiwar politician has been rejected as a candidate in Russia's presidential ballot as the country prepares to go the polls next month.

title.children: A Putin challenger has been barred from Russia's election — here's who could still be in the running

image.altText: Flying fox

props.synopsis: The children were seen playing with a flying fox at Queens Park last Saturday.

title.children: Authorities working to find children potentially exposed to deadly bat-borne virus

image.altText: A man screams in excitement, wearing a white racing suit, during a promotional shoot

props.synopsis: Australian Formula 1 driver Daniel Ricciardo has said his team is "no longer just a platform for Red Bull Racing".

title.children: Ricciardo bullish in optimism as his new car is unveiled

image.altText: Des Hasler arrives at court

props.synopsis: The inquest into the death of Manly Sea Eagles player Keith Titmuss heard evidence from former coach Des Hasler who described the 20-year-old as a "beautiful boy".

title.children: 'So, so sorry': Ex-Manly coach tells family of young player who died after training he 'shares heartbreak'

image.altText: Two red and grey military drones.

props.synopsis: A locally designed combat drone will receive a significant funding boost as the Australian Defence Force works to catch up with rapid advances in lethal unmanned technology across the world.

title.children: Funding boost for lethal 'Ghost Bat' drone project as defence industry minister confirms new armed drone will be introduced this year

image.altText: Senator Barbara Pocock peers sceptically over the top of her lowered glasses as she sits at a senate committee

props.synopsis: Two former PwC partners on the Tax Practitioners Board did not recuse themselves from a meeting where the board's investigation of PwC was discussed, a Senate committee hears.

title.children: Consulting inquiry homes in on conflicts of interest in PwC investigation

image.altText: Penguin on sandy white beach ith bush on sandhills in background, bay water on right.

props.synopsis: A Port Neill local filmed a juvenile king penguin on a beach on Wednesday, nearly two weeks after a sighting of what was possibly the same bird in the Coorong.

title.children: Second king penguin spotted acting 'happy' in South Australia, 2,500km from nearest colony

image.altText: A close up of a former IT worker in India

props.synopsis: Former IT worker Abhishek Mishra alleges that he owes fees and penalties on almost $400,000 in tax debts because NBN Co and EY have breached their employment obligations to remit the taxes and provide him with "proper and independent" taxation advice.

title.children: IT worker alleges he's up for late fees and penalties on almost $400,000 because NBN and EY failed him

image.altText: Tony Burke sitting on the front bench in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The government says it will change new right-to-disconnect laws to prevent employers from facing criminal penalties for contacting employees after working hours.

title.children: Employers could face criminal penalties for contacting employees out of hours after right-to-disconnect mistake

image.altText: two people stand together

props.synopsis: Jess and Jackie Morecroft can finally hunt for their new "castle" after winning a court battle for compensation for mortgage fraud of their Mermaid Beach home.

title.children: Queensland government loses appeal against $2.7m payout to Gold Coast mortgage fraud victims

image.altText: South Africa jump up and down as they celebrate taking an Australian wicket

props.synopsis: England, India and South Africa all claim the gap between Australia and the rest of the world is closing in women's cricket. But there is a difference in opinion amongst the Aussie camp, with some refusing to believe a gap ever existed.

title.children: Life after Lanning: Is the gap closing between Australia and the rest of the world?

image.altText: Vladimir Putin gestures while sitting in a chair across from Tucker Carlson

props.synopsis: No-one should be surprised Vladimir Putin and Tucker Carlson have agreed to speak to each other — today's chat is beneficial for both the long-time Russian autocrat, and the dumped Fox News host.

title.children: 'Don't you know that?': The strange conversation between Vladimir Putin and Tucker Carlson

image.altText: Donald Trump looks stern with US flag behind him.

props.synopsis: America's top court weighs Donald Trump's presidential eligibility in a constitutional test legal experts describe as one of the most consequential cases the US has seen in decades. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: How a forgotten section of the US constitution could thwart Donald Trump's re-election hopes

image.altText: Adiba looks out across the Melbourne city in the evening with blurred city lights in the background

props.synopsis: Former members of the Afghan National Women's team who fled the Taliban are now playing in exile in Melbourne. But they're still fighting for recognition on the world stage.

title.children: 'Do you really want to leave everything?' A split-second decision, and a shot at a different future

image.altText: Computer-generated graphic showing an aerial view of an urban estate with existing houses and paddocks in the surrounding areas.

props.synopsis: The first property to be developed under the Resilient Lands Program will not come onto the market until 2026, four years after devastating floods left thousands looking for somewhere safer to live.

title.children: 'It's too late for most of us': 400 homes for Lismore flood victims to enter market. The catch is it won't be until 2026
